alert.note: Alert for Lexington; Richland (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 05 at 9:04PM EDT until April 10 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Columbia has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in South Carolina... Congaree River At Columbia affecting Lexington and Richland Counties. .An intense storm system produced locally heavy rainfall across the Midlands. Rainfall amounts from 1 to 3 inches fell across the Midlands. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Congaree River At Columbia. * WHEN...From this evening to Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Flooding occurs in flood prone areas near and downstream from Columbia. Flooding also occurs on parts of the Cayce and West Columbia river walk. At 13.0 feet, Flooding occurs in flood prone areas near and downstream from Columbia. Flooding also occurs over much of the Cayce and West Columbia river walk. At 14.0 feet, Roads in low lying areas and swampland downstream from Columbia become flooded. Most of the Cayce and West Columbia river walk is flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM EDT Tuesday the stage was 7.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 13.8 feet early Thursday afternoon. - Action stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood stage is 19.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 900 AM EDT.
